quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Newhart and Rodney Dangerfield
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bobs, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is unusual about the opening credits of the sitcom Newhart?

options.text: They show a scene from an old Bob Newhart show
They show Bob living in Chicago.
They show Bob and Marcia driving to Vermont.
They show a scene from On Golden Pond.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They show a scene from On Golden Pond.

questions.question: What is true about The Bob Newhart Show?

options.text: The expression Hi, Bob was said 256 times.
The expression Love that Bob! was said 199 times.
Bobs character has trouble relating to his teenage daughter.
Bobs character is sued for malpractice in his psychiatry practice.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The expression Hi, Bob was said 256 times.

questions.question: Who played Bobs blond wife in Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Frann

questions.question: Who played the rich, spoiled Stephanie Vanderkellen in the sitcom Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Duffy

questions.question: Besides the 1994 American Comedy Award for lifetime creative achievement, what other significant award did comedian, Rodney Dangerfield win?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grammy

questions.question: Comedian Rodney Dangerfields first participation in cinema was in 1971, in this movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Projectionist

questions.question: Comedian and actor, Rodney Dangerfield was born Jacob Cohen on November 22, 1921 in which US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: How does the last season of  the show Newhart end?

options.text: Bob wakes up next to Emily and finds that he has been dreaming the entire show.
Bob awakens to find that he has two wives, one blond and one brunette and he owns an inn and a psychology practice.
Bob awakens to find that he is an Illinois psychiatrist who has just bought  a Vermont inn and the entire cast of The Bob Newhart Show is in the inn.
Bob wakes up to find the inn is under sixty inches of snow and the characters are forced to get along.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob wakes up next to Emily and finds that he has been dreaming the entire show.

questions.question: What role does Bob Newhart play in Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Loudin

questions.question: Actor and comedian, Rodney Dangerfield bought a Manhattan nightclub in 1969, which he turned into a comedy club, named what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dangerfields

questions.question: William Sanderson played the local weirdo Larry in Newhart. What were the names of his brothers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darryl and Darryl

questions.question: In the Christmas episode of Newhart, who comes to the inn the day after Christmas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The three Weismans

questions.question: When did the sitcom Newhart air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1982-1990

questions.question: American comedian, Rodney Dangerfield had two significant relationships in his life, with which two of these women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joyce Indig and Joan Childs

questions.question: Who portrayed the handyman in Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Poston

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Michael Richards and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, dangerfield, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these pseudonyms did comedian Rodney Dangerfield use, before settling on the one he became famous with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Roy

questions.question: Boris Karloff was born in 1887 in London, England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After the controversial performance in the fall of 2006, Michael Richards opened the next night at the very same location.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On what nighttime television program did Michael Richards apologize via satellite for the comedy club incident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Late Show with David Letterman

questions.question: After the Michael Richards incident in the fall of 2006, comedian Paul Mooney, former regular on the Dave Chappelle Show and frequent user of the N word, vowed never to use that word again in a live press conference.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On October 5, 2004, actor and comedian Rodney Dangerfield, 82, passed away at the UCLA Medical Center in Los Angeles, California. His death was the result of which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart valve-replacement surgery

questions.question: In addition voicing the character of Burnss son, Larry Burns, on The Simpsons, Dangerfield was also involved which of these animated films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rover Dangerfield

options.text: A character in one of Dangerfields movies

questions.question: Has it ever been reported that Michael Richards has made anti-Semitic remarks in the past as well?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What did Michael Richards claim was the cause of his racial tirade in a comedy club in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uncontrolled rage

questions.question: When did the notorious incident in which actor Michael Richards was involved in a shouting match with members of the audience during which he made racist statements happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November 17, 2006

questions.question: Boris was orphaned at an early age and raised by his siblings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On what day did Richards appear on late night TV via satellite to apologize and explain the situation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November 20, 2006

questions.question: The first films Boris made in Hollywood were silent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Did the comedy club in which the racist incident happened eventually ban Michael Richards from performing at their venue in the future?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

options.text: When the Moon shows he starts acting crazy
He has suppressed his anger all his life
Sugar makes him do insane things

options.text: He wishes for a new daddy
He wishes his dad would stop lying for a day

questions.question: It was while making this movie that Elizabeth Taylor met her fifth husband, Richard Burton. This movie cost 40 million to make and four years to bring to the big screen. questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Velvet
